text:
Bluff City is a city in Harper County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 65 people lived there.
History.
Bluff City was created about 1879. The city was named after Bluff Creek, which goes near it.
Bluff City was a station and shipping point on the Kansas Southwestern Railway.
Geography.
Bluff City is at (37.075671, -97.875376). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Weather.
Bluff City has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. According to the Köppen Climate Classification system, Bluff City has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 65 people, 29 households, and 13 families living in Bluff City.
Education.
Bluff City is a part of USD 361 Chaparral Schools.
